sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

co review:

gerku co blanu = ?
djacu co glare = ?

(Answers: blue dog, hot water)

New Material (5-7 min)

Multiple Modifiers with co

You can chain modifiers after co:

mi pinxe lo djacu co glare co jinsa

I drink water which-is-hot which-is-clean.

Each co adds another modifier to the head word (djacu).

Order of co Modifiers

djacu co glare co jinsa

= hot clean water = jinsa glare djacu (in normal tanru order)

The modifiers stack from right to left.

When co Improves Readability

Long tanru problem:

lo barda melbi blanu gerku

The big beautiful blue dog — but you don't see "dog" until the end.

With co:

lo gerku co barda co melbi co blanu

The dog which-is-big which-is-beautiful which-is-blue — you see "dog" first!

Complex Example

mi citka lo plise co xunre co glare co sudga

I eat an apple which-is-red which-is-hot which-is-dry. (= I eat a dry hot red apple)

Key Point

Use co when you want the main noun visible early, with modifiers following.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Build co Chains

Convert to co form with multiple modifiers:

  1. barda blanu zdani → ? (house first)
  2. cmalu xunre mlatu → ? (cat first)
  3. glare jinsa djacu → ? (water first)
Answers
  1. zdani co barda co blanu
  2. mlatu co cmalu co xunre
  3. djacu co glare co jinsa

Exercise 2: Translate with co

Translate using co:

  1. I want cold clean water.
  2. I see a big blue dog.
  3. This is a small red house.
Answers
  1. mi djica lo djacu co lenku co jinsa
  2. mi viska lo gerku co barda co blanu
  3. ti zdani co cmalu co xunre

Exercise 3: Understand co Chains

What does each mean in English?

  1. lo mlatu co barda co xekri
  2. lo plise co cmalu co pelxu co sudga
  3. lo djacu co lenku co curve co jinsa
Answers
  1. A big black cat
  2. A small yellow dry apple
  3. Cold pure clean water

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I drink cold clean water." → mi pinxe lo djacu co lenku co jinsa
  2. "This is a big blue house." → ti zdani co barda co blanu
  3. "I see a small red cat." → mi viska lo mlatu co cmalu co xunre

Today's Grammar

co chains:

Form Meaning
A co B B A
A co B co C C B A
A co B co C co D D C B A

Summary

You practiced chaining multiple modifiers with co. Each co adds a modifier to the head word.
